text: Why close a `Channel`? Why not just let it go out of scope like any other variable?

elements.text: ? Why not just let it go out of scope like any other variable?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56214| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
To signal "no more items" I think, e.g. if you iterate over it.

elements.text: To signal "no more items" I think, e.g. if you iterate over it.

text: ahh ok, I see. So like `for elt in chan` will stop iterating when the channel gets closed. Cool, makes sense! Was worried there was some weird gc issue I didn’t get.
